title: ButtonAppearance
content: Appearance of the button.

title: ButtonAppearance
content: basic - No background color, Selector color is applied to text color. Ripple effect on hover.flat - Default button appearance. Selector color is applied to background. Ripple effect on hover.stroked - Button with border. Selector color is applied to border color. Ripple effect on hover.icon - Button with icon only. Spacing are squared. Ripple effect on hover.icon-stroked - Button with icon only and border. Spacing are squared. Ripple effect on hover.fab - Floating action button. Circular button with icon only. Ripple effect on hover.

title: ButtonComponent
content: Button component with different colors, appearances, and sizes. Also supports disabled property to prevent click events.

title: ButtonComponent
content: Appearance of the button.

title: ButtonComponent
content: Color of the button.

title: ButtonComponent
content: Whether the button should be disabled; Prevents triggering the click event.

title: ButtonComponent
content: Whether the button should take the full width or not.

title: ButtonComponent
content: Whether the button should have rounded corners or not.

title: ButtonComponent
content: Size of the button. Changes the font size and the padding applied.

title: ButtonComponent

title: IconComponent

content: Aspect ratio of the icon (must match css aspect-ratio property)

content: Color of the icon (must match css aspect-ratio property)

title: IconComponent
content: Inject the element reference to render the svg content in the component

title: IconComponent
content: Name of the icon. (must match the filename located in assets/icons folder, without extension .svg)

title: IconComponent
content: Optional path to the icons folder. Default is /icons

title: IconComponent
content: Size of the icon (must include css unit). Default is '1.5rem'

title: IconComponent
content: Subscription to the icon name changes in order to render the svg content

title: NotificationService
content: Simple notification service that allows to send notifications to the user. They are stored in local storage and available through signal. Checkout out Notification interface to see how to customize them.

content: Send Error notification with given params to the user.

title: NotificationService
content: Send Success notification with given params to the user.

title: NotificationService
content: Send Warning notification with given params to the user.

title: NotificationService
content: Clears local notifications list.

title: NotificationService
content: Send all current notifications.

title: NotificationService
content: all notifications as Signal.

title: NotificationService
content: Send notification with given params to the user.

content: Marks notification as seen.

title: Requirements
content: All of the components in this library use tailwind to render the UI. So make sure you have it configured on you project or adapt the code accordingly.

title: Requirements
content: In this folder, you can add all SVG required for your UI. You can also creates sub-folders but be aware, you'll need to format name as folderName/fileName.

title: Requirements
content: With this component, you can control the fill of the SVG by adding some color of the component (works by inheritance).

title: Requirements
content: Make sure the path match your icons location. You can always change it when you call the icon, but you can also make the change globally by changing the default value.

title: Requirements
content: This service helps working with files in general but this component requires getSVG() method. Simply copy paste this service or get isolated method. Check Sources tab for more information.

title: Requirements

title: Welcome
content: Tired of having to fight with frameworks behavior ? Want to regain control of your UI without having to overrides all components. This project help you create your own component without any extras dependencies. Ok, actually you are going to need 3:

title: Welcome
content: Angular (can't do much without it)Tailwind (helps simplify harmonious UI)Angular cdk (a lot of handful tools there)

title: Welcome
content: If you are ok with using thoses dependencies, this project is made for you ! This is not a framework, nor a cdk, but simply a collection of components following best practices in angular web development.

title: Welcome
content: This repository was created as a model for creating actual application. Feel free to use take any components you want üôå
